page.title: 18Brigstock Latham School
page.content: The first school was endowed in 1620 by the{Rev.Nicholas Latham}on the site where the war memorial now stands. The {Ladies Fitzpatrick}built a school in {Back Lane}while{Lord Lyveden}opened another in the{High Street.}The fees were 2d. a week and 1d. for infants. In 1873 the trustees were asked to exchange the site of the schools for a new one the cost being paid by the{ {Duke of Buccleuch.}All the other schools were closed down. In 1949 it became a Primary School, the older children going to Corby. Extensions were built in 1954. For its centenary celebrations{Princess Alice of {Gloucester }was the guest of honour. There are over 100 children in four classes at present. The Parent / Teacher Association raises money for such extras as PE equipment and a music centre.
